summary: This is an email chain from July 6, 2020, between U.S. Pretrial Services and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the intake and upcoming arraignment of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes logistical coordination for her interview and attaches the indictment and a government motion for detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant who has been indicted and is being processed for arraignment and a bail hearing. She is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury.

persons.name: Chris Everdell

events.title: Maxwell's Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to be arraigned and have a bail hearing before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrival in SDNY
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York and is expected to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York on or about July 6, 2020, and was to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
Her arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled for July 10, 2020, before Judge Nathan.
The government filed a motion for detention, indicating they were seeking to have Maxwell held without bail.
Her retained defense counsel were identified as Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
